ğŸ”¹ `HTTP Request (Bright Data Web Unlocker)` | | --------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------- | | ğŸ“Œ **Goal** | Automatically fetch webinar details from Eventbrite (or any event site) | | ğŸ› ï¸ **How it works** | | 1. **â° `Schedule Trigger`** This node runs the entire workflow at a preset time (e.g., daily at 8 AM). It ensures your automation runs hands-free â€” no manual clicking. 2. **ğŸŒ `HTTP Request`** This node uses **Bright Data's Web Unlocker** to bypass bot detection and scrape real event pages from protected websites like Eventbrite. The **POST** request is sent to `https://api.brightdata.com/request`, which returns **raw HTML** of the event listings page. ğŸ’¡ *Why Bright Data?* Websites like Eventbrite use anti-bot systems. Bright Data safely navigates that with proxies + human-like browsing. ---

## ğŸ§© SECTION 2: ğŸ” **Extract & Structure Event Data** ### ğŸ§  Purpose: Turn messy HTML into clean, usable event info --- | ğŸ”§ **Nodes Involved** | ğŸ”¹ `HTML Extract`
ğŸ”¹ `Code Node` | | --------------------- | -------------------------------------------------------- | | ğŸ“Œ **Goal** | Isolate event titles, times, and links from the raw HTML | | ğŸ› ï¸ **How it works** | | 1. **ğŸ§¾ `HTML Extract`** This node lets you select elements from the HTML using **CSS selectors**, just like a web developer would. You extract: * `.eds-event-card-content__title` â†’ **Title** * `.eds-event-card-content__sub-title` â†’ **Date & Time** * `.eds-event-card-content__action-link[href]` â†’ **Event URL** 2. **ğŸ§® `Code Node`** Here, we **loop through the extracted data** and format it into clean JSON objects: ```js return items[0].json.titles.map((title, i) => { return { json: { title, date: items[0].json.dates[i], link: items[0].json.links[i] } }; }); ``` Result: You now have a list of clean, structured webinar entries. ğŸ’¡ *Why use a code node?* It transforms raw scraped chunks into usable pieces ready for storage or integration. ---

| ğŸ“Œ **Goal**          | Automatically log each event into a spreadsheet |
| ğŸ› ï¸ **How it works** |                                                 |

* This node appends each structured event entry to a connected **Google Sheet**.
* Each row includes:
  ğŸ“Œ `Event Title` | ğŸ“… `Date & Time` | ğŸ”— `URL`
* You can filter, sort, or share this sheet as a **database of upcoming webinars**.

ğŸ’¡ *Why Google Sheets?*
Itâ€™s universal, easy to search/filter, and sharable with a team. No special tool or database needed.
